STATE OF MICHIGAN
GRETCHEN WHITMER DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR LANSING DIRECTOR
May 18, 2021
Darnell Britt
Community Care Organization
18688 Joann
Detroit, MI 48205
RE: License #: CB820315857
Investigation #: 2021C0217022
Community Care Organization
Dear Mr. Britt:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
FOR CWL ONLY
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the ISEP and
your contract.
611 W. OTTAWA  P.O. BOX 30664  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov/lara  517-335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Vivian D. Malleck, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
4th Floor, Suite 4B
51111 Woodward Avenue
Pontiac, MI 48342
(248) 860-3284
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DEPARTMENT OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
License #: CB820315857
Investigation #: 2021C0217022
Complaint Receipt Date: 04/09/2021
Investigation Initiation Date: 04/13/2021
Report Due Date: 06/08/2021
Licensee Name: Community Care Organization
Licensee Address: 18688 Joann
Detroit, MI 48205
Licensee Telephone #: (313) 920-4268
Administrator: Kendra Washington
Licensee Designee: Darnell Britt
Name of Facility: Community Care Organization
Facility Address: 18688 Joann
Detroit, MI 48205
Facility Telephone #: (313) 920-4268
Original Issuance Date: 07/30/2013
License Status: REGULAR
Effective Date: 01/30/2020
Expiration Date: 01/29/2022
Capacity: Unknown
Program Type: CHILD PLACING AGENCY, PRIVATE
1

II. ALLEGATIONS
Violation
Established?
Staff person 1 called law enforcement regarding a 04/09/2021 No
incident between Youth A and Staff person 1.
Community Care Organization independent living youth are locked No
out of their home, Joann House.
Community Care Organization independent living youth are No
unsupervised.
Community Care Organization independent living youth do not No
receive routine medical appointments.
Additional Findings Yes
III. METHODOLOGY
04/09/2021 Special Investigation Intake
2021C0217022
04/13/2021 Special Investigation Initiated - Telephone
04/13/2021 Contact - Telephone call made
Interviewed Staff person 1
04/14/2021 Contact - Telephone call made
Interviewed Youth A and Youth B
04/14/2021 Contact - Document Received
Reviewed Youth A and Youth B’s MISACWIS case files
04/15/2021 Contact – Telephone call made
Interviewed Case worker 1 and 2
Left message with Staff person 1
05/17/2021 Contact – Telephone call made
Interviewed Staff person 1
Preliminary exit
2

ALLEGATION:
Staff person 1 called law enforcement regarding a 04/09/2021 incident between
Youth A and Staff person 1.
INVESTIGATION:
Joann House is an independent living program for 6 males. It is operated through
Community Care Organization.
Staff person 1
I interviewed Staff person 1 on 04/12/2021 by telephone. Staff person 1 stated she
was in her basement office on 04/09/2021 when Youth A knocked and opened the
door asking for his cell phone. Staff person 1 stated Youth A was redirected to go
upstairs. Staff person 1 stated the laundry room door was open and Youth A pushed
Staff person 1 into the laundry room. Staff person 1 stated Case manager 1 was in
the laundry room and redirected Youth A to go upstairs but Youth A said, “I need my
stuff.” Staff person 1 stated Youth A pulled a bag from under Staff person 1’s feet
causing her to fall and hit her head. Staff person 1 stated she called law
enforcement.
Case manager 2
I interviewed Case manager 2 on 04/15/2021 by telephone. Case manager 2 stated
she went to the laundry room from her basement office and redirected Youth A to go
upstairs on 04/09/2021 during the incident between Staff person 1 and Youth A.
Youth A
I interviewed Youth A on 04/14/2021 by telephone. Youth A stated he went
downstairs to the laundry room area to look for his laptop charger. Youth A stated
Staff person 1 was standing on the charger cord and fell down when he pulled the
cord. Youth A stated Staff person 1 did not push him and he did not push Staff
person 1.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12503 Policy and procedures.
(1) An agency shall have and follow written policies and
procedures for the independent living services provided.
ANALYSIS: Staff person 1 has the right to call law enforcement. Calling law
enforcement to press charges is outside the scope of
Department of Child Welfare Licensing.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
3

ALLEGATION:
Community Care Organization independent living youth are locked out of their home,
Joann House.
INVESTIGATION:
Staff person 1
I interviewed Staff person 1 on 04/12/2021 and 05/17/2021 by telephone. Staff
person 1 stated the youth do not have a front door key and the front door remains
locked to Joann House. Staff person 1 stated Joann House provided front door keys
in the past to the youth, but the keys were lost or copied and kept by discharged
youth causing multiple lock replacements. Staff person 1 stated she and the case
managers work at Joann House 8:30 am to 5:00 pm on business weekdays and a
staff person is at the house 3:00 pm to 7:00 am every day of the week to open the
front door for the youth. Staff person 1 stated youth inside the home are permitted to
open the front door to other Joann House youth. Staff person 1 stated youth may
also call the 24-hour, 7 day a week contact number and a staff person will go to the
home to open the door for the youth if nobody is at the home.
Youth A
I interviewed Youth A on 04/14/2021 by telephone. Youth A stated the front door is
locked from 7:00 am to 3:00 pm. Youth A stated if a youth leaves and returns to
Joann House between 7:00 am and 3:00 pm the youth waits for another Joann
House youth inside or staff to open the front door. Youth A stated he has a list of
staff to call if nobody is at Joann House. Youth A stated he has the licensee
designee, chief administrator and his therapist’s telephone numbers.
Youth B
I interviewed Youth B on 04/14/2021 by telephone. Youth B stated the youth do not
have a key to the front door of Joann House. Youth B stated if a youth leaves the
facility between 7:00 am and 3:00 pm there is a possibility of not being able to enter
Joann House if nobody is at the house. Youth B stated he has never been locked
out of Joann House.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12503 Policy and procedures.
(2) The policies and procedures shall cover at least all of the
following areas:
(b) Types of living arrangements provided or approved.
4

ANALYSIS: The front door to Joann House is locked and Joann House
youth are not provided a front door key due to past issues of lost
keys and unauthorized copying of the front door key. Joann
House typically has a staff person at the house on business
workdays, who can open the front door. Youth inside Joann
House are permitted to open the front door to allow another
Joann House youth in. Youth can call the 24-hour, 7 day a week
contact numbers for staff to come and open the front door if
nobody is at the house. It is found that it may be inconvenient
for youth not to have a front door key, but youth are not locked
outside of Joann House without means to enter.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
ALLEGATION:
Community Care Organization independent living youth are unsupervised.
INVESTIGATION:
Joann House is an independent living plus program. This type of program requires
staffing from 3:00 pm to 7:00 am on school days and 16 hours on non-school days.
Staffing is not required from 7:00 am to 3:00 pm. Youth must attend school or work
or do both to remain in the program.
Staff person 1
I interviewed Staff person 1 on 04/12/2021 by telephone. Staff person 1 stated staff
are scheduled to work from 3:00 pm to 7:00 am each day (school days and non-
school days). Staff person 1 stated administrative and case manager staff are at
Joann House 8:30 am to 5:00 pm on business workdays.
Youth A and Youth B
I interviewed Youth A and Youth B separately on 04/14/2021 by telephone. Youth A
and Youth B stated staff are at the facility from 3:00 pm to 7:00 am daily.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12503 Policy and procedures.
(2) The policies and procedures shall cover at least all of the
following areas:
(e) Supervision provided by the agency.
5

ANALYSIS: Youth A and Youth B stated staff are at the facility from 3:00 pm
to 7:00 am daily. This meets the requirements of an
independent living plus program.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
ALLEGATION:
Community Care Organization independent living youth do not receive routine
medical appointments.
INVESTIGATION:
Youth A
I interviewed Youth A on 04/14/2021 by telephone. Youth A stated he receives
routine medical appointments. Youth A’s MiSACIWS file was reviewed. Youth A was
placed at Joann House on 08/21/2020. Youth A had a physical exam on 01/21/2021
and a dental exam on 08/04/2020.
Youth B
I interviewed Youth B on 04/14/2021 by telephone. Youth B stated he has not had a
physical or dentist appointment since his placement at Community Care
Organization. I reviewed Youth B’s MiSACWIS case file. Youth B was placed at
Joann House on 08/17/2020. Youth B had a physical exam on 12/08/2020. Youth
B’s last dental examination was on 11/06/2019. Youth B had a tooth extraction on
06/28/2020. Youth B was scheduled for a dental exam on 10/14/2020 but slept
through his appointment time.
Case manager 1
Case manager 1 stated COVID 19 delayed the rescheduling of Youth B’s dental
appointment.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12507 Medical/dental and mental health care.
(1) An agency shall ensure that a youth in independent living
receives any needed medical, dental, and mental health care as
required in R 400.12413. Medical, dental, and mental health
care provided shall be documented in the youth's record.
6

ANALYSIS: Allowances to medical and dental exam time frames for
completion were given due to COVID 19. Youth A and Youth B’s
medical and dental needs are met.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
Youth B was placed at Joann House on 08/17/2020. His last
dental exam was on 11/06/2019. Youth B missed his
10/14/2020 dental appointment. A dental exam was due by
11/17/2020 or documentation of Youth B’s refusal. Technical
assistance is provided due to COVID 19.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
ADDITIONAL FINDINGS:
Youth A and Youth B’s MiSACWIS files were reviewed on 04/14/2021. Required
monthly budgets and quarterly independent living contracts were not found.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12505 Supervision.
(2) An agency shall provide the following minimum supervision.
(b) At monthly intervals ensure that the youth is complying with
the terms of the contract required by R 400.12510, continues to
reside in a safe and acceptable environment and is managing
expenditures.
ANALYSIS: Youth A and Youth B’s monthly budgets are not in MiSACWIS.
All documents must be completed or uploaded in MiSACWIS
because this is the official record.
CONCLUSION: REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Special Investigation 2020C0108050 cited this rule for lack of
supervision in determining if the living environment is safe and
acceptable.
Corrective action plan approved 11/02/2020
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12510 Independent living contract.
(2) The agreement shall be signed and dated by the youth and
the social service worker. The contract shall be reviewed and
updated at least once every 90 calendar days and a copy
provided to the youth.
7

ANALYSIS: Youth A and Youth B’s quarterly contracts are not in
MiSACWIS. All documents must be completed or uploaded in
MiSACWIS because this is the official record.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
The continuance of a regular license is recommended upon receipt of an approved
corrective action plan.
05/18/2021
________________________________________
Vivian D. Malleck Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
May 18, 2021

8
